person.persName: Samuel Knox, Sr. (St. Louis, Missouri, attorney, councilman, and politician/US Congress)

body.p: St. Louis, Missouri, attorney, councilman, and politician. Blandford, Massachusetts, native. Graduated from Williams College in 1836. Graduated from Harvard Law School in 1838. Moved to St. Louis in 1838. Married to Mary Kurr Knox on March 18, 1845. Father of Samuel Knox, Jr., Hannah S. Knox, Reuben Knox, Henry Knox, and Mary Knox. City Councilman in St. Louis in 1845. Attorney in St. Louis. Partner at the law firm of Knox & Smith in 1864, 1865, and 1866. Member of the United States House of Representatives from the first district of Missouri from 1864 to 1865.
